channel.title: Comments on: 371 N. St. Andrews Update
channel.description: Blogging demolitions one building at a time.

item.title: By: Nathan Marsak
item.dc:creator: Nathan Marsak
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.riplosangeles.com/371-n-st-andrews-update/#comment-13">C.C.</a>.
Hey C. C. ! So, if you're looking for demolition permits in general in the last couple weeks, go to http://planning.lacity.org/ and click "Case Reports" in the green bar, that will open a window called "Latest Cases" which is about the last two weeks' worth.
If you're looking for information pertaining to a particular address, there's http://zimas.lacity.org/ which'll give you stuff like year built and most recent case numbers.
For my money though you want to go to DBS records at http://ladbsdoc.lacity.org/idispublic/ and I usually order them by date. LA records were lost pre-1905, so that can be a problem. But at least more recent stuff like demo permits should be there.
Protip: when searching an address in DBS make sure you've checked every last variation of the address (in the upper left hand side of the Zimas listing) especially if that property is on a corner.
Don't know if any of this helps, PM me if you need screenshots of stuff perhaps? N
item.content:encoded:
In reply to C.C..

Hey C. C. ! So, if you’re looking for demolition permits in general in the last couple weeks, go to http://planning.lacity.org/ and click “Case Reports” in the green bar, that will open a window called “Latest Cases” which is about the last two weeks’ worth.

If you’re looking for information pertaining to a particular address, there’s http://zimas.lacity.org/ which’ll give you stuff like year built and most recent case numbers.

For my money though you want to go to DBS records at http://ladbsdoc.lacity.org/idispublic/ and I usually order them by date. LA records were lost pre-1905, so that can be a problem. But at least more recent stuff like demo permits should be there.

Protip: when searching an address in DBS make sure you’ve checked every last variation of the address (in the upper left hand side of the Zimas listing) especially if that property is on a corner.

Don’t know if any of this helps, PM me if you need screenshots of stuff perhaps? N

item.title: By: C.C.
item.dc:creator: C.C.
item.description: How exactly do you search for demolition permits? I'm having a hard time with those websites...
item.content:encoded: How exactly do you search for demolition permits? I’m having a hard time with those websites…

item.title: By: squeakytiki
item.dc:creator: squeakytiki
item.description: That's because most of the big developers these days are from some other country. They don't care about southern California history because it is not THEIR history. Sad, but true.
item.content:encoded: That’s because most of the big developers these days are from some other country. They don’t care about southern California history because it is not THEIR history. Sad, but true.
